title: Tyson Fury 'could make WWE in-ring debut at Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia'
text:
Tyson Fury could make his WWE in-ring debut at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia.

The lineal heavyweight champion watched Smackdown on Friday night and ended up getting involved in an argument with Braun Strowman as part of the show.

He ended up jumping over the barricades and had to be pushed back by security as he attempted to climb into the ring.

Tyson Fury could make his WWE in-ring debut at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia

Braun Strowman threw Dolph Ziggler into Fury, causing him to fall back on Smackdown

Fury will now appear on Raw on Monday night to discuss the situation with Strowman.

And he is now expected to have a match with Strowman at Crown Jewel on October 31 instead of the previously mooted date at next year's Wrestlemania.

TalkSPORT have reported that ESPN, who promote Fury's fights, and FOX, who have recently started broadcasting Smackdown, are working together on the match.

Part of the plan is to use it to promote the rematch between Fury and Deontay Wilder.
description: The lineal heavyweight champion watched Smackdown on Friday night and ended up getting involved in an argument with Braun Strowman as part of the show. He jumped the barricades.
